While it's true that they only need to buy 18 more robes since they already have 12, the $60 figure represents the total investment in robes for the entire 30-person choir.

At $2 per robe, buying robes for 30 singers means a total expenditure of 30 x $2 = $60. This is the full amount the school will have spent on choir robes once they purchase the remaining 18 needed. The 12 robes they already own are part of that total $60 investment as well.
